DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study investigate safety efficacy irreversible electroporation ( IRE ) unresectable renal tumor .
DOC.brief_title: Irreversible Electroporation ( IRE ) For Unresectable Renal Tumors
DOC.detailed_description: By enrol patient renal tumor adapt enrolled criterion , study document first time safety short long term efficacy percutaneous intraoperative IRE renal tumor .
DOC.criteria: unresectable kidney tumor patient refuse surgical therapy Karnofskyindex > 70 % Age ≥ 18 ≤ 80 year life expectancy ≥ 12 month compliance patient take part study inform consent violation one inclusion criterion estimate glomerular filtration rate ( eGFR ) < 30 mL/min/1.73 m2 QTinterval > 550 m cardiac arrhythmia condition myocardial infarction , make ECGsynchronisation unfeasible active infection severe health interference , make take part study unfeasible pregnancy , lactation period general contraindication anesthesia , endotracheal anesthesia muscle relaxation psychiatric disorder make take part study give informed consent unfeasible haemorrhage , impossible intermission take blood thinner , untreatable thrombophilia thromboplastin time ≤50 % , thrombocytes ≤50 Gpt/L ; partial thromboplastin time > 50 untreated urinary retention severe hepatic dysfunction clinically important renal , hematological , metabolic , neurological , gastrointestinal , hepatic pulmonary disorder dysfunction prevent study participation ( investigator 's assessment ) take part another clinical study renal tumor .
